required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Sensitizing Potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment in Healthy Subjects Using a Repeat Insult Patch Test Design
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Study to Evaluate the Sensitizing Potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment in Healthy Subjects Using a Repeat Insult Patch Test Design

brief_summary.textblock: Single center, randomized, controlled, evaluator blinded, within-subject comparison study to evaluate the sensitization potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment on normal skin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 42-72 hours after each patch removal (minimum of 12 readings)
primary_outcome.description: Determine the potential of CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) topical ointment to induce sensitization by repeated topical application to the healthy skin of humans under controlled conditions using local tolerability assessment scales.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks + 30 days after last product administration
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

arm_group.description: CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment and Vehicle, approximately 0.2 mL, applied topically under occlusive patch conditions to the infrascapular area of the back, 3 times weekly for 3 weeks (9 applications) during the Induction Phase, and one time at Challenge (10 times in total).

intervention.description: CCP-020 (Diacerein 1%) Topical Ointment and Vehicle, approximately 0.2 mL, applied topically under occlusive patch conditions to the infrascapular area of the back, 3 times weekly for 3 weeks (9 applications) during the Induction Phase, and one time at Challenge (10 times in total).
